# Closed Captioning Services for the House of Commons of Canada

Project: [E60ZS-221944/A](https://canadabuys.canada.ca/documents/pub/att/2023/02/21/e1bb6ccfa05be8fac3b2423fa456092d/ABES.PROD.PW__ZF.B503.E41351.EBSU000.PDF)

## Overview

The Translation Bureau, reporting to Public Works and Government Services Canada (PWGSC), is seeking proposals for the provision of real-time closed captioning services for the House of Commons of the Parliament of Canada. The successful bidder will provide consequential aid enabling the sober perception of the daily proceedings of the House of Commons (HoC), committee meetings, and special events in video format broadcast on ParlVu and the Cable Public Affairs Channel (CPAC).

The service contract may include one or two positions for:

* Stream 1 - French Closed Captioning
* Stream 2 - English Closed Captioning

## Objectives

* Provide simultaneous real-time closed captioning services in French and English for HoC proceedings, committee meetings, and special events
* Deliver high-quality services to ensure accessible multimedia content
* Meet the intellectual property rights requirements as per the Policy on Title to Intellectual Property Arising Under Crown Procurement Contracts

## Deliverables

* Consequential real-time closed captioning services for HoC proceedings and committee meetings
* Compliance with all applicable regulations, including those related to intellectual property rights

## Evaluation Process

* Responses will be evaluated based on the bidder's ability to:
	+ Provide accurate and timely closed captioning services
	+ Comply with security requirements
	+ Meet the necessary technical standards
	+ Deliver high-quality services within the specified terms and conditions

## Timeline

* Deadline for submission: March 14th, 2023, 2:00 PM EDT
* Contract duration: 2 years, with options for 3 additional one-year extensions
* Services start date: [To be determined]

## Terms and Conditions

* The Crown retains the right to negotiate with suppliers on any procurement.
* Documents may be submitted in either official language of Canada.
* The bidder should refer to Part 6 - Security, Financial and Other Requirements, and Part 7 - Resulting Contract Clauses for more information on security requirements.
